text: I approve of fucking over the Red Wings
I don’t think you’re getting that second baby anytime soon.
I'd guess he's much more disturbed by the thought that he gets that second one because his wife finds the make-over . . . motivating.
I'm taking her to Flavortown
From the cover of Cosmo: "Dip your fingers in chili oil before getting intimate. It'll spice up your night!"
Hard pass
Ironically enough hard pass is the name of that move
This is out of left field, but has anyone had any experience in event promotion?
In what context? I often run events for my local Barnes and Noble.
Since I work there

Unofficially, I ran my 30 person play group at my last station before I moved up here. But it wasn't really "event promotion", we mostly gained players by word of mouth and used a facebook group to disseminate news of drafts or events with prizes in general
My wife was an event planner.
I get promo cards sometimes
I'm helping out with a Halloween party/fundraiser and we're having some trouble selling tickets, just wondering if there are strategies to get more people to notice it at least
Prizes. When in doubt, people love free stuff
What is your current sales channel?

We're selling Tix through Eventbrite, have a Facebook post with 200+ interested and like 3 tickets sold. We've set emails to Chicago event blogs and news organizations along with event websites, not to mention local clubs

The most important thing I have found when promoting something has to do with excitement and volume of people. If you're excited about the event then show that excitement and tell everyone you see! When people see your excitement they will feed off that. Tell them to tell people and give out advertising for it if you can. Having everyone involved pester people with excitement is more effective than you may think.
People don't read, nor do they actually like to commit to things unless you pester them about it.
Oh I know
Lol
What's the fundraising for?
The Japanese American Service Committee (JASC), they promote traditional and pop arts and activities
They asked my group, AnimeChicago, to help out with their usually stuffy fundraiser, so we could target younger people
That sounds fun! Maybe see if you can get bonuses for people signing up a week or more in advance. Idk how much control you have over that.
how you reached out to local college campuses?
Yep, practically all of them
Or maybe try to get in contact with local cosplayers and see if they will promote it.
how much is a ticket btw?
$25, includes 2 free drinks
Already trying that, but thanks
